p: Different aspects of reproductive physiology are described in well-considered and thought-provoking reviews by Cao et al. (2017) and Ozga et al. (2017) . Cao et al. examine the dependence of soybean flowering and stem growth habits on day length, highlighting the interplay between photoperiod and miRNA-mediated flowering modules in soybean. Meanwhile, Ozga et al. cast the net beyond soybean to explore how hormones integrate high-temperature stress during reproductive development in grain legumes, from meiosis to flowering, fruit set and seed maturation. Moreover, a gene expression atlas is described for pigeon pea ( Pazhamala et al., 2017 ), together with the application of this knowledge to deduce novel information regarding the genes associated with pollen fertility and seed formation.
